verses.kjv: Therefore leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ, let us go on unto perfection; not laying again the foundation of repentance from dead works, and of faith toward God,
verses.ct: So let's move beyond the basic teachings about Christ and press on toward maturity. We shouldn't keep going back to lay the foundation all over again — turning away from useless works, trusting in God,

verses.kjv: Of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.
verses.ct: instruction about baptisms, the placing of hands on people, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.

verses.kjv: And this will we do, if God permit.
verses.ct: And we will move forward, if God allows it.

verses.kjv: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened, and have tasted of the heavenly gift, and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost,
verses.ct: Because it is impossible for people who once received the light, who experienced the heavenly gift, who shared in the Holy Spirit,

verses.kjv: And have tasted the good word of God, and the powers of the world to come,
verses.ct: who experienced how good God's word is and the powers of the coming age,

verses.kjv: If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto repentance; seeing they crucify to themselves the Son of God afresh, and put him to an open shame.
verses.ct: and who then turn away — it is impossible to bring them back to repentance again, because they are nailing the Son of God to the cross all over again and publicly disgracing him.

verses.kjv: For the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it, and bringeth forth herbs meet for them by whom it is dressed, receiveth blessing from God:
verses.ct: Ground that soaks up the rain falling on it frequently and produces crops useful to those who farm it receives a blessing from God.

verses.kjv: But that which beareth thorns and briers is rejected, and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be burned.
verses.ct: But ground that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and near to being cursed. In the end, it will be burned.

verses.kjv: But, beloved, we are persuaded better things of you, and things that accompany salvation, though we thus speak.
verses.ct: But dear friends, even though we are saying these things, we are convinced that better things are true of you — things that go along with salvation.

verses.kjv: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love, which ye have shewed toward his name, in that ye have ministered to the saints, and do minister.
verses.ct: God is not unjust. He will not forget your hard work and the love you have shown for his name by serving his people, which you continue to do.

verses.kjv: And we desire that every one of you do shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end:
verses.ct: We want each of you to show that same dedication all the way to the end, so that your hope will be fully realized.

verses.kjv: That ye be not slothful, but followers of them who through faith and patience inherit the promises.
verses.ct: Don't become lazy. Instead, follow the example of those who through faith and patience receive what God has promised.

verses.kjv: For when God made promise to Abraham, because he could swear by no greater, he sware by himself,
verses.ct: When God made his promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater to swear by, he swore by himself,

verses.kjv: Saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee.
verses.ct: saying, 'I will certainly bless you and give you an enormous number of descendants.'

verses.kjv: And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise.
verses.ct: After waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.

verses.kjv: For men verily swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation is to them an end of all strife.
verses.ct: People swear by someone greater than themselves, and an oath serves as a guarantee that settles every dispute.

verses.kjv: Wherein God, willing more abundantly to shew unto the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath:
verses.ct: Because God wanted to make it absolutely clear to those who would inherit the promise that his purpose would never change, he guaranteed it with an oath.

verses.kjv: That by two immutable things, in which it was impossible for God to lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:
verses.ct: So through 2 unchangeable things — in which it is impossible for God to lie — we who have run to take hold of the hope offered to us can be powerfully encouraged.

verses.kjv: Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into that within the veil;
verses.ct: This hope serves as an anchor for our souls, firm and secure. It reaches into the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,

verses.kjv: Whither the forerunner is for us entered, even Jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of Melchisedec.
verses.ct: where Jesus has already entered on our behalf as a forerunner. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchisedec.
